user.title: Automation Suggestions
user.description:
This integration watches your manual actions (lights, switches, etc.) and suggests automations based on patterns.

**After setup:**
1. Go to Developer Tools → Services → `automation_suggestions.analyze_now` to run your first scan
2. View results in the **Top Suggestions** sensor attributes
3. You'll get notifications for high-confidence suggestions (80%+)

**Tip:** Wait 1-2 weeks for best results - the more history, the better the patterns.

data_description.analysis_interval: How often to scan your logbook for patterns. Lower values find patterns faster but use more resources.
data_description.lookback_days: How many days of history to analyze. More days = better pattern detection, but slower analysis.
data_description.min_occurrences: How many times you must repeat an action before it's suggested as an automation. Lower values suggest more automations.
data_description.consistency_threshold: How consistent the timing must be (0.7 = 70%). Higher values only suggest actions you do at very regular times.
data_description.user_filter_mode: Choose how to filter users: 'none' analyzes all users, 'exclude' ignores selected users, 'include' only analyzes selected users.
data_description.filtered_users: Comma-separated list of user IDs (UUIDs) to filter. Leave empty if filter mode is 'none'.
data_description.domain_filter_mode: Choose how to filter integration domains: 'none' analyzes all, 'exclude' ignores selected domains, 'include' only analyzes selected domains.
data_description.filtered_domains: Comma-separated list of domains to filter (e.g., nodered, appdaemon, pyscript). Leave empty if filter mode is 'none'.

init.title: Automation Suggestions Options
init.description:
**View your suggestions:** Check the Top Suggestions sensor attributes or call `automation_suggestions.analyze_now` in Developer Tools → Services.

Adjust these settings to tune pattern detection:

data_description.analysis_interval: How often to scan your logbook for patterns. Lower values find patterns faster but use more resources.
data_description.lookback_days: How many days of history to analyze. More days = better pattern detection, but slower analysis.
data_description.min_occurrences: How many times you must repeat an action before it's suggested as an automation. Lower values suggest more automations.
data_description.consistency_threshold: How consistent the timing must be (0.7 = 70%). Higher values only suggest actions you do at very regular times.
data_description.user_filter_mode: Choose how to filter users: 'none' analyzes all users, 'exclude' ignores selected users, 'include' only analyzes selected users.
data_description.filtered_users: Comma-separated list of user IDs (UUIDs) to filter. Leave empty if filter mode is 'none'.
data_description.domain_filter_mode: Choose how to filter integration domains: 'none' analyzes all, 'exclude' ignores selected domains, 'include' only analyzes selected domains.
data_description.filtered_domains: Comma-separated list of domains to filter (e.g., nodered, appdaemon, pyscript). Leave empty if filter mode is 'none'.

analyze_now.name: Analyze now
analyze_now.description: Scan your logbook history immediately for patterns instead of waiting for the scheduled analysis. Use this after changing settings or to get fresh suggestions.

dismiss.name: Dismiss suggestion
dismiss.description: Permanently hide a suggestion you don't want. The suggestion won't appear again even after future analyses. Find suggestion IDs in the Top Suggestions sensor attributes.

suggestion_id.name: Suggestion ID
suggestion_id.description: The unique ID of the suggestion to dismiss (e.g., 'light_kitchen_turn_on_07_00'). Find this in the Top Suggestions sensor attributes.
